string.name: android_market_description_text
string.translation_description:
For the Android Market (not used in the app), the description text.
Character limit: 4000.

resources.string:
Use My Tracks while you run, bike, hike, or do anything else outdoors, and it will use the GPS sensor in your phone to record the path you took. It will also gather useful statistics such as time, speed, distance, and elevation. You can review all of this data live, or you can save it for use later. While you're out, you can mark relevant waypoints, and can ask to hear automatic voice announcements about your progress.
 
 My Tracks can record data from external sensors:
 - Zephyr Technology Consumer HxM Bluetooth heart rate monitor
 - Polar Bluetooth heart rate monitor
 - ANT+ heart rate monitors (*)
 - SRM power meters, speed, and cadence sensors (*)
 - More sensor support coming soon
 
 * ANT+ and SRM support requires an ANT+ compatible phone
 
 My Tracks can share your track data:
 - As a GPX, KML, CSV, or TCX file
 - Using Google My Maps, Google Fusion Tables, or Google Docs
 - Via Twitter or Facebook
 
 Other features:
 - Record in Metric or Imperial units (configured from the Recording menu, under Settings)
 - Display your movement in terms of Speed or Pace (configured from the Display menu, under Settings)
 
 My Tracks is run by volunteers and Googlers in their 20% time. If you would like to contribute, please visit:
 
 http://mytracks.googlecode.com

string.name: android_market_promo_text
string.translation_description:
For the Android Market (not used in the app), the promotion text.
Character limit: 80.

resources.string: My Tracks allows you to record and share your GPS tracks, including statistics.

In the main view, the message on the top asking the user to enable GPS.

On application start, message when there is no GPS on the device.

string.translation_description:
In the main view, the message on the top indicating My Tracks is waiting for a better GPS fix.
Screenshot: gps_wait_fix.png

resources.string: Waiting for a better GPS fix. Make sure the sky is visible.

string.name: import_error
string.translation_description:
When importing all the tracks, a toast message indicating import error for one of the tracks.
%1$s: the track's file path on the SD card. E.g., '/mnt/sdcard/MyTacks/gpx/1.gpx'.

string.name: import_gpx_files_few
string.translation_description:
When importing all the tracks, phrase for 'few' GPX files.
%1$d an integer number. The number is a small number.

string.name: import_gpx_files_many
string.translation_description:
When importing all the tracks, phrase for 'many' GPX files.
%1$d an integer number. The number is a large number.

string.name: import_gpx_files_one
string.translation_description: When importing all the tracks, phrase for 1 GPX file.

string.name: import_gpx_files_other
string.translation_description:
When importing all the tracks, phrase for 'other' GPX files, 'other' means for cases that the language does not require special treatment of the given quantity.
%1$d an integer number.

string.name: import_gpx_files_two
string.translation_description: When importing all the tracks, phrase for 2 GPX files.

string.name: import_gpx_files_zero
string.translation_description: When importing all the tracks, phrase for 0 GPX files.

string.name: import_no_file
string.translation_description:
After importing all the tracks from the SD card, the alert message indicating that no track is imported.
%1$s: the SD card directory path. E.g., '/mnt/sdcard/MyTracks/gpx/'. Screenshot: import_no_file.png

resources.string: No GPX file found in %1$s. The SD card may be unreadable or the directory may not contain any GPX file.

string.name: import_success
string.translation_description:
After importing all the tracks from the SD card, the alert message indicating success.
%1$d the number of successfully imported tracks. E.g., '1'. %2$s the number of GPX files in the SD card. E.g., '1 GPX file' or '2 GPX files'. %3$s the SD card directory path. E.g., '/mnt/sdcard/MyTracks/gpx/'. Screenshot: import_success.png

string.name: my_location_approximate_location
string.translation_description:
When displaying the user's current location, a status message indicating that GPS is not available and an approximate location is used instead.
Screenshot: my_location_approximate_location.png

resources.string: GPS is not available. An approximate location based on cell towers and WiFi networks is shown.

string.name: my_location_no_location
string.translation_description:
When displaying the user's current location, a status message indicating that the current location cannot be determined.
Screenshot: my_location_no_location.png

resources.string: GPS is not available. Current location cannot be determined. Enable more location sources (see \'Location & security\' settings) & make sure the sky is visible. Try again later.

string.name: my_maps_list_error
string.translation_description: When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the text on the 'My Maps' list page informing the user that his maps cannot be loaded at this time.

resources.string: Your maps could not be loaded at this time.

string.translation_description: When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the progress dialog message informing the user that his maps are being loaded.

When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the text on the 'My Maps' list page informing the user that he doesn't have any maps.

When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the text on the 'My Maps' list page asking the user to pick one of his maps.

string.translation_description:
When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, in the 'My Maps' list page, the label next to the maps that are public, as opposed to being unlisted.

string.name: my_maps_list_title
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the title of the page listing the user's maps in Google My Maps.

string.name: my_maps_list_unlisted_label

string.name: my_tracks_app_name

When viewing the 'Running services' on Android, the name of the My Tracks service that is recording a track in the background.

string.name: permission_notification_description
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to receive My Tracks notifications, the permission description that the Android Market shows to the user.

resources.string: Allows the application to receive notifications when My Tracks starts or stops a recording.

string.name: permission_notification_label
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to receive My Tracks notifications, the permission label that the Android Market shows to the user.

string.name: permission_read_description
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to read My Tracks data, the permission description that the Android Market shows to the user.

resources.string: Allows the application to read My Tracks data.

string.name: permission_read_label
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to read My Tracks data, the permission label that the Android Market shows to the user.

string.name: permission_write_description
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to write data to My Tracks, the permission description that the Android Market shows to the user.

resources.string: Allows the application to write data to My Tracks and start/stop My Tracks recording.

string.name: permission_write_label
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to write data to My Tracks, the permission label that the Android Market shows to the user.

resources.string: write data to My Tracks and start/stop My Tracks recording

string.translation_description:
When exporting a track to the SD card, a message indicating that the export operation was canceled.

string.translation_description: When writing to the SD card, the error message when not able to create a directory on the SD card.

resources.string: Unable to create a directory on the SD card.

string.name: sd_card_error_no_storage
string.translation_description: When writing to the SD card, the error message when the SD card is not found.

resources.string: No external storage was found. Make sure that a SD card is inserted and that your phone is not mounted to a computer.

string.name: sd_card_error_read_file
string.translation_description: When reading from the SD card, the error message when not able to read a file.

resources.string: Unable to read from a file.

string.name: sd_card_error_write_file
string.translation_description: When writing to the SD card, the error message when not able to write a file.

resources.string: Unable to write to a file.

string.translation_description:
When writing to the SD card, the progress dialog message indicating that it may take a while.

resources.string: Exporting a track to the SD card. This may take a while.

string.name: sd_card_success_read_file
string.translation_description:
When reading from the SD card, the success message when finish reading from the SD card.

resources.string: Finished reading from the SD card.

string.name: sd_card_success_write_file
string.translation_description:
When writing to the SD card, the success message when finish writing to the SD card.

resources.string: Finished writing to the SD card.

string.name: send_google_by_my_tracks
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, a note indicating it is created by My Tracks on Android. %1$s: the html anchor opening tag, ''. Please place this placeholder before the app name, 'My Tracks'. %2$s: the html anchor closing tag, ''. Please place this placeholder after the app name, 'My Tracks'.

string.name: send_google_choose_account_title
string.translation_description:
When sending to Google, the dialog title to choose a Google account.
Screenshot: send_google_choose_account.png

string.name: send_google_docs
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google, under the 'Send to...' dialog, the checkbox option to send to Google Docs.
Screenshot: send_google_choose_service.png

string.name: send_google_error
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, a message indicating that an error has occurred and ask the user to try again.

resources.string: An error has occurred. Please try again.

string.name: send_google_existing_map
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google My Maps, the radio option to use an existing map as opposed to create a new map.
Screenshot: send_google_choose_service.png

string.name: send_google_fusion_tables
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google, under the 'Send to...' dialog, the checkbox option to send to Google Fusion Tables.
Screenshot: send_google_choose_service.png

string.name: send_google_my_maps
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google, under the 'Send to...' dialog, the checkbox option to send to Google My Maps.
Screenshot: send_google_choose_service.png

string.name: send_google_new_map
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google My Maps, the radio option to create a new map as opposed to use an existing map.
Screenshot: send_google_choose_service.png

string.name: send_google_no_account_message
string.translation_description: When sending to Google, the dialog message when no Google account is found.

resources.string: No account found to upload tracks to.

string.name: send_google_no_account_title
string.translation_description: When sending to Google, the dialog title when no Google account is found.

string.name: send_google_progress_authenticating
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to a Google service, the message on the progress dialog indicating authenticating to the service.
%1$s: service name. 'Google My Maps', 'Google Fusion Tables', or 'Google Docs'.

string.name: send_google_progress_creating
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to a Google service, the message on the progress dialog indicating creating a new service item.
%1$s: service name. 'Google My Maps', 'Google Fusion Tables', or 'Google Docs'.

string.name: send_google_progress_preparing_track
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is preparing the track's data for upload.

string.name: send_google_progress_reading_track
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is reading the track from its database.

string.name: send_google_progress_sending
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google service, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is sending the track data.
%1$s: service name. 'Google My Maps', 'Google Fusion Tables', or 'Google Docs'.

string.name: send_google_recorded
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, in the track description, a tag for the track recorded date. E.g., 'Recorded: Tue Sep 06 15:08:30 PDT 2011'.

string.name: send_google_result_header
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google, the header on the top of the result page.
Screenshot: send_google_success.png

string.name: send_google_result_share_url
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google, in the result dialog, the button on the bottom to share with friends the URL of the uploaded track.
Screenshot: send_google_success.png

string.name: send_google_send_now
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google, under the 'Send to...' dialog, the button on the bottom to send the track to the selected Google services.
Screenshot: send_google_choose_service.png

string.name: send_google_success_footer
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google, the additional comment on the bottom of the result page.
Screenshot: send_google_success.png

resources.string: It may take a few minutes before new tracks appear.

string.name: send_google_title
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google, the dialog title to choose the Google services to send the track to. The user can choose Google My Maps, Google Fusion Tables, and Google Docs.
Screenshot: send_google_choose_service.png

string.name: send_google_track_part_label
string.translation_description:
When sending a track to Google, the label to name segments when splitting a large track.
%1$d: part number. E.g., '1'.

string.name: sensor_state_battery
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the battery level on the bike sensor. E.g, 'Battery level: 50 %'.
Screenshot: sensor_state_none.png

string.name: sensor_state_cadence
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the cadence on the bike sensor. Cadence is the number of revolutions of the crank per minute. E.g., 'Cadence: 80 rpm'.
Screenshot: sensor_state_none.png

string.name: sensor_state_connected
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the 'Sensor state' value when the sensor has connected.
Screenshot: sensor_state_connected.png

string.name: sensor_state_connecting
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the 'Sensor state' value when the sensor is connecting.
Screenshot: sensor_state_connecting.png

string.name: sensor_state_disconnected
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the 'Sensor state' value when the sensor has disconnected.
Screenshot: sensor_state_disconnected.png

string.name: sensor_state_heart_rate
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the heart rate from a heart rate sensor. E.g., 'Hear rate: 100 bpm'.
Screenshot: sensor_state_none.png

string.name: sensor_state_last_sensor_time
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the last time the sensor has sent a data. E.g., 'Last sensor time: 10:05 am'.
Screenshot: sensor_state_none.png

string.name: sensor_state_power
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the label for the power from the bike sensor. Power is the power output of the rider. E.g., 'Power: 50 W'.
Screenshot: sensor_state_none.png

string.name: sensor_state_sending
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sensor state' page, the 'Sensor state' value when the sensor is sending data.
Screenshot: sensor_state_sending.png

string.name: settings_backup
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, the option to change the data backup related settings.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line) Screenshot: settings.png

string.name: settings_backup_now
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, under the 'SD card backup' section, the option to backup to the SD card now.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_backup.png

string.name: settings_backup_now_progress_message
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, after pressing the 'Backup now' option, the progress dialog telling the user that it is writing all tracks and settings and that it may take a while.
Screenshot: settings_backup_now_progress_message.png

resources.string: Writing all tracks and settings to the SD card. This may take a while...

string.name: settings_backup_now_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, under the 'SD card backup' section, the summary for the 'Backup now' option explaining that all tracks and settings will be written to the SD card.
Screenshot: settings_backup.png

resources.string: Write a full copy of all your tracks and settings to the SD card.

string.name: settings_backup_restore
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, under the 'SD card backup' section, the option to restore everything from the SD card.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_backup.png

string.name: settings_backup_restore_confirm_message
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, after pressing the 'Restore now' option, the message in the alert dialog asking the user to confirm that he wants to restore from a backup and it will overwrite all the current tracks and settings.
Screenshot: settings_backup_restore_confirm_message.png

resources.string: Restoring a backup from the SD card will overwrite all your current tracks and settings. Are you sure?

string.name: settings_backup_restore_no_backup
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, after pressing the 'Restore now' option, the message in the alert dialog informing the user that there is no backup to restore from.
Screenshot: settings_backup_restore_no_backup.png

string.name: settings_backup_restore_progress_message
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, after pressing the 'Restore now' option, the message on the progress dialog indicating that My Tracks is reading all tracks and settings from the backup on the SD card and that it may take a while.
Screenshot: settings_backup_restore_progress.png

resources.string: Reading all tracks and settings from the SD card. This may take a while...

string.name: settings_backup_restore_select_title
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, after pressing the 'Restore now' option, the title in the picker dialog asking the user to select a backup.
Screenshot: settings_backup_restore_select_title.png

string.name: settings_backup_restore_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, under the 'SD card backup' section, the summary for the 'Restore now' option explaining that it restores all tracks and settings from the SD card.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_backup.png

resources.string: Restore all tracks and settings from the SD card.

string.name: settings_backup_sd_card
string.translation_description:
In the 'Backup' settings, the section header for configuring backup to the SD card.
Character limit: ~40 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_backup.png

string.name: settings_display
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, the option to change the display related settings.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line) Screenshot: settings.png

string.name: settings_display_metric
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, the checkbox option to use the metric units.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_display.png

string.name: settings_display_metric_summary_off
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, the summary for the 'Use metric units' checkbox when it is unchecked explaining using the imperial units to display distances.
Screenshot: settings_display_unchecked.png

resources.string: Use imperial units to display distances.

string.name: settings_display_metric_summary_on
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, the summary for the 'Use metric units' checkbox when it is checked explaining using the metric units to display distances.
Screenshot: settings_display.png

resources.string: Use metric units to display distances.

string.name: settings_display_speed
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, the checkbox option to display speed (e.g., 5 miles per hour) instead of pace (e.g., 0.2 hours per mile).
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_display.png

string.name: settings_display_speed_summary_off
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, the summary for the 'Display speed' checkbox when it is unchecked explaining that pace (e.g., 0.2 hours per mile) will be used instead of speed (e.g., 5 miles per hour).
Screenshot: settings_display_unchecked.png

string.name: settings_display_speed_summary_on
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, the summary for the 'Display speed' checkbox when it is checked explaining that speed (e.g., 5 miles per hour) will be used instead of pace (e.g., 0.2 hours per mile).
Screenshot: settings_display.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, the dropdown option to choose a track color mode for how to use different colors to color a track based on slow, medium, and fast speed.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_display.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color_dynamic
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, for the 'Track color mode' dropdown, the option to use different colors to color a track based on dynamically determined speed thresholds. E.g., use one color when the speed is below the slow speed threshold.
Character limit: ~21 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_display_track_color_option.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color_dynamic_medium
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, under the 'Dynamic thresholds' configurations, the option for configuring the percentage from the average speed for the medium speed range. The track color mode will use different colors to color a track depending on whether the speed is above, in, or below the medium speed range.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_display.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color_dynamic_medium_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, under the 'Dynamic thresholds' configurations, the summary for the 'Percentage from average' option explaining that it sets the percentage from the average speed for the medium speed range. The track color mode will use different colors to color a track depending on whether the speed is above, in, or below the medium speed range.
Screenshot: settings_display.png

resources.string: Percentage from the average speed for the medium speed range.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, for the 'Track color mode' dropdown, the option to use different colors to color a track based on fixed speed thresholds. E.g., use one color when the speed is below the slow speed threshold.
Character limit: ~21 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_display_track_color_option.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed_medium
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, under the 'Fixed thresholds' configurations, the option for configuring the medium speed threshold. Thus any speed lower than the threshold but greater than the slow speed threshold will be colored by the medium speed color.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_display.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed_medium_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, under the 'Fixed thresholds' configurations, the summary for the 'Medium speed threshold' option explaining that it sets a cutoff speed for the medium speed color.
Screenshot: settings_display.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed_slow
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, under the 'Fixed thresholds' configurations, the option for configuring the slow speed threshold. Thus any speed lower than the threshold will be colored by the slow speed color.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_display.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed_slow_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, under the 'Fixed thresholds' configurations, the summary for the 'Slow speed threshold' option explaining that it sets a cutoff speed for the slow speed color.
Screenshot: settings_display.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color_single
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, for the 'Track color mode' dropdown, the option to use a single color for all speeds.
Character limit: ~21 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_display_track_color_option.png

string.name: settings_display_track_color_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Display' settings, the summary for the 'Track color mode' dropdown explaining that it configures how colors are used to color a track based on slow, medium, and fast speed.
Screenshot: settings_display.png

resources.string: The way to color a track based on slow, medium, and fast speed.

string.name: settings_not_while_recording
string.translation_description:
In settings, the summary for an option that is not available during a track recording.
Screenshot: settings_not_while_recording.png

resources.string: Not available while recording a track.

string.name: settings_recording
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, the option to change the track recording related settings.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line) Screenshot: settings.png

string.name: settings_recording_auto_resume
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the dropdown option to configure the timeout after which a recorded track will not be continued after phone reboot.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_recording_bottom.png

string.name: settings_recording_auto_resume_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Auto-resume timeout' dropdown option explaining that it configures the maximum time after which a previous recording will not be resumed after phone reboot.
Screenshot: settings_recording_bottom.png

resources.string: Maximum time after which a previously recording track will not be resumed after phone reboot.

string.name: settings_recording_default_activity
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the option to specify a new track's default activity type.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_recording_bottom.png

string.name: settings_recording_default_activity_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Default activity type' option explaining that it sets the default activity type for a new track.
Screenshot: settings_recording_bottom.png

resources.string: Default activity type for a new track.

string.name: settings_recording_distance
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the dropdown option to configure the distance between two recorded points.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

string.name: settings_recording_distance_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Distance between points' dropdown option explaining that it configures the smallest distance between two recordings of your position.
Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

resources.string: Smallest distance between two recordings of your position.

string.name: settings_recording_gps_accuracy
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the dropdown option to configure the required GPS accuracy. If a GPS position's accuracy is below the requirement, then it will not be used.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

string.name: settings_recording_gps_accuracy_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'GPS accuracy' dropdown option explaining that it configures the required accuracy for your position. If a GPS position's accuracy is below the requirement, then it will not be used.
Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

resources.string: GPS position will be ignored if it is not this accurate.

string.name: settings_recording_interval
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the dropdown option to configure the time between two recorded points.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

string.name: settings_recording_interval_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Time between points' dropdown option explaining that it configures the smallest time interval between two recordings of your position.
Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

resources.string: Smallest time interval between two recordings of your position.

string.name: settings_recording_marker
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the dropdown option to configure the time or distance a new marker will be inserted.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

string.name: settings_recording_marker_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Marker frequency' dropdown option explaining that it configures the time or distance after which a new marker will be inserted.
Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

resources.string: Time/distance after which a new marker will be inserted.

string.name: settings_recording_name
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the checkbox on whether the track should be named based on the track's start time or based on a number.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_recording_bottom.png

string.name: settings_recording_name_summary_off
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Use time for track name' checkbox when it is unchecked explaining using a number as the default track name.
Screenshot: settings_recording_bottom_unchecked.png

resources.string: Use a number as the default track name.

string.name: settings_recording_name_summary_on
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Use time for track name' checkbox when it is checked explaining using the track's start time as the default track name.
Screenshot: settings_recording_bottom.png

resources.string: Use the track\'s start time as the default track name.

string.name: settings_recording_track_distance
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the dropdown option to configure the distance between two tracks.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

string.name: settings_recording_track_distance_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Distance between tracks' dropdown option explaining that it configures the maximum distance for two recorded points for them to be still considered as the same track.
Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

resources.string: Track will be split if two recordings of your position are further than this.

string.name: settings_recording_voice
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the dropdown option to configure the voice announcement frequency.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

string.name: settings_recording_voice_not_available
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Voice frequency' explaining that this option is not available on your Android phone.
Screenshot: settings_recording_voice_not_available.png

resources.string: Voice announcement is not available on your Android phone.

string.name: settings_recording_voice_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Recording' settings, the summary for the 'Voice frequency' dropdown option explaining that it configures the time or distance between two voice announcements.
Screenshot: settings_recording_top.png

string.name: settings_reset
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, the option to reset everything to the defaults.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line) Screenshot: settings.png

string.name: settings_reset_dialog_message
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, after pressing the 'Reset to defaults' option, the confirmation dialog asking the user to confirm reverting all settings to defaults. But the saved tracks will be preserved.
Screenshot: settings_reset_dialog_message.png

resources.string: All your settings will be erased and reverted to the default values. Saved tracks will be preserved. Are you sure?

string.name: settings_reset_done
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, after pressing the 'Reset to defaults' option, the confirmation dialog informing the user that all settings have been reverted to their defaults.
Screenshot: settings_reset_done.png

resources.string: All settings have been reverted to their defaults.

string.name: settings_reset_summary
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, the summary for the 'Reset to defaults' option explaining reverting all the settings to the default values.
Screenshot: settings.png

resources.string: Revert all your settings to the default values.

string.name: settings_sharing
string.translation_description:
In the 'Settings' page, the option to change the track sharing related settings.
Character limit: ~26 (1 line) Screenshot: settings.png

string.name: settings_sharing_allow_access
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sharing' settings, the checkbox option to allow third party apps access to the My Tracks data.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_sharing.png

string.name: settings_sharing_allow_access_confirm_message
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sharing' settings, after checking the 'Allow access' checkbox, the confirmation dialog asking the user if he wants to allow other apps, including apps installed in the future, to control and access My Tracks data. In addition, no further notification of third party app access will be shown.
Screenshot: settings_sharing_allow_access_confirm_message.png

resources.string: Are you sure you want to allow other apps, including future apps, to control and access My Tracks data? There will be no further notification.

string.name: settings_sharing_allow_access_summary_off
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sharing' settings, the summary for the 'Allow access' checkbox option when it is unchecked explaining that other apps cannot read, write, start/stop recording My Tracks data.
Screenshot: settings_sharing_unchecked.png

resources.string: Other apps cannot read, write, start/stop recording My Tracks data.

string.name: settings_sharing_allow_access_summary_on
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sharing' settings, the summary for the 'Allow access' checkbox option when it is checked explaining that other apps can read, write, start/stop recording My Tracks data.
Screenshot: settings_sharing.png

resources.string: Other apps can read, write, start/stop recording My Tracks data.

string.name: settings_sharing_map_public
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sharing' settings, the checkbox option to make a new map created in Google My Maps public.
Character limit: ~23 (1 line) Screenshot: settings_sharing.png

string.name: settings_sharing_map_public_summary_off
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sharing' settings, the summary for the 'Make new maps public' checkbox option when it is unchecked explaining that new maps created in Google My Maps will be unlisted, as opposed to public.
Screenshot: settings_sharing_unchecked.png

resources.string: Make new maps created in Google My Maps unlisted.

string.name: settings_sharing_map_public_summary_on
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sharing' settings, the summary for the 'Make new maps public' checkbox option when it is checked explaining that new maps created in Google My Maps will be public, as opposed to unlisted.
Screenshot: settings_sharing.png

resources.string: Make new maps created in Google My Maps public.

string.name: settings_sharing_url_only
string.translation_description:

string.translation_description:
In the 'Sharing' settings, the summary for the 'Share only URL link' checkbox option when it is unchecked explaining that some text and the the URL link will be sent when sharing the URL with friends.
Screenshot: settings_sharing_unchecked.png

resources.string: Some text and the URL link will be sent when sharing the URL with friends.

string.name: settings_sharing_url_only_summary_on
string.translation_description:
In the 'Sharing' settings, the summary for the 'Share only URL link' checkbox option when it is checked explaining that only the URL link, without any additional text, will be sent when sharing the URL with friends.
Screenshot: settings_sharing.png

string.name: voice_template
string.translation_description:
For the voice announcement, the template to make an announcement.
%1$s: distance string. E.g., '1 mile' or '1.2 miles', '1 kilometer', '2.2 kilometers' %2$s: time string. E.g., '1 hour and 30 minutes' or '20 minutes 1 second' %3$s: speed/pace string. For speed, e.g., '2.2 miles per hour', '1 kilometer per hour'. For pace, e.g., '2 hours 1 minute per mile', '30 minutes 1 second per kilometer'.

resources.string: My Tracks total distance %1$s in %2$s at %3$s.

string.name: welcome_about
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the button on the bottom to open the 'About My Tracks' dialog.
Screenshot: welcome.png

string.name: welcome_add_graph_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on adding graphs to the graphs view.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: In the graphs view, Menu -> Chart settings.

string.name: welcome_add_graph_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on adding graphs to the graphs view.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: How do I add more graphs?

string.name: welcome_app_navigation_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on app navigation.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Touch the map. Left and right arrows will appear. Tap on these arrows to cycle between the map, statistics, and graphs view.

string.name: welcome_app_navigation_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on app navigation.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: How do I see the map, statistics, and graphs view?

string.name: welcome_battery_life_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on battery life.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: The GPS receiver draws a relatively high amount of power, so a fully charged battery typically survives less than 5 hours. Battery life depends on many factors, including signal strength, battery freshness, and tasks running in parallel. Switching off some or all of the phone\'s radios will lengthen battery life. Putting the phone into Airplane mode will yield the best results.

string.name: welcome_battery_life_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on battery life.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: How long does the battery last when recording tracks?

string.name: welcome_data_connection_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on data connection.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Cell signal or data connection is not required to record GPS tracks. However, if there is no data connection, you will not be able to see a map. Instead, you will see a grey screen or a partial map. Tracks, represented as simple lines, can still be recorded even if there is no data connection.

string.name: welcome_data_connection_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on data connection.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Do I need cell signal and data connection to use My Tracks?

string.name: welcome_delete_all_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on deleting all tracks.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Menu -> Tracks -> Delete all. This permanently deletes the recorded tracks from memory. If you have saved tracks to the SD card, you must delete them separately. Tracks uploaded to Google My Maps, Google Fusion Tables, and Google Docs must also be deleted separately.

string.name: welcome_delete_all_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on deleting all tracks.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: How do I delete all the tracks from the phone?

string.name: welcome_edit_accuracy_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on editing points.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Once you upload tracks to Google My Maps, Google Fusion Tables, or Google Docs, you can move, delete or insert individual track points as desired.

string.name: welcome_edit_accuracy_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on editing points.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: How can I edit or correct tracks for accuracy?

string.name: welcome_elevation_precision_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on elevation precision.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: GPS receivers measure elevations much less precisely than latitude and longitude. Elevations can sometimes be off by a few hundred feet, though relative changes are tracked more precisely. To get a good elevation measurement, make sure that you have a strong GPS signal and wait a few minutes for the elevation to settle to a stable value.

string.name: welcome_elevation_precision_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on elevation precision.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: How precise is the elevation measurement?

string.name: welcome_gps_fix_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on the GPS fix message.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: For My Tracks to work, your phone needs to be in line-of-sight contact with the GPS satellites. If the line-of-sight is obstructed by trees, buildings or canyon walls, you may not get an accurate fix. If you see the message, wait a minute or two. If your device does not achieve a fix, move to an area clear of obstructions and try again.

string.name: welcome_gps_fix_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on the GPS fix message.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Why does the application sometimes display \"Waiting for a better GPS fix. Make sure the sky is visible.\"?

string.name: welcome_location_precision_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on location precision.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Under optimal conditions, the location error can be +/- 20 feet (6 meters). However, precision depends on the quality of the GPS signal. The blue circle around the orange location arrow indicates estimated precision. (You may need to zoom in or out to see the circle.) You can change the GPS precision at Settings -> Recording -> GPS accuracy. If the precision is too low, at the top of the screen, you will see the message \"Waiting for a better GPS fix.\".

string.name: welcome_location_precision_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on location precision.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: How precise are the recorded tracks?

string.name: welcome_my_maps_sharing_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on Google My Maps visibility.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: By default, new maps are public. To change the default to unlisted, uncheck Settings -> Sharing -> Make new maps public. You can change the visibility of all your maps at Google My Maps.

string.name: welcome_my_maps_sharing_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on Google My Maps visibility.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Who can see the maps I send to Google My Maps?

string.name: welcome_my_tracks_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on what is My Tracks.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: My Tracks allows you to record GPS tracks and visualize your hiking, running, biking or any other activity while watching live performance statistics. My Tracks makes it easy to archive your training history with Google My Maps, Google Fusion Tables, and Google Docs, and share your activities with friends and the world.

string.name: welcome_my_tracks_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on what is My Tracks.
Screenshot: welcome.png

string.name: welcome_send_google_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on sending a track to Google.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Tap the Options button located at the bottom right corner of the map view and select \"Send to Google...\".

string.name: welcome_send_google_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on sending a track to Google.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: How do I send my tracks to Google My Maps, Google Fusion Tables, and Google Docs?

string.name: welcome_share_file_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on sharing a file.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: You can use Google Earth or similar applications to visualize and edit GPS tracks.

string.name: welcome_share_file_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on sharing a file.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: What can I do with tracks after saving them to the SD card or sharing such files with friends?

string.name: welcome_share_friends_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on sharing a track with friends.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Tap the Options button located at the bottom right corner of the map view and select \"Share with friends...\". You can share the track as a link to Google My Map or Google Fusion Table (you will be prompted to upload the track first) or as a GPX, KML, CSV, or TCS file in an e-mail attachment.

string.name: welcome_share_friends_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on sharing a track with friends.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: How do I share tracks with friends and the rest of the world?

string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on splitting long tracks.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Tracks on Google My Maps and Google Fusion Tables are limited to certain sizes.

string.name: welcome_split_track_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on splitting long tracks.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Why do very long tracks split into multiple segments upon sending them to Google My Maps and Google Fusion Tables?

string.name: welcome_statistics_marker_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on statistics markers.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Statistics markers are used to segment a track to calculate statistics for each segment. For example, let\'s say you are recording a bike ride up a hill, you can insert a statistics marker at the bottom of the hill and another at the top by pressing Menu -> Markers -> Insert statistics.

string.name: welcome_statistics_marker_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on statistics markers.
Screenshot: welcome.png

string.name: welcome_title

In the 'Welcome' page, the title of the page.
Screenshot: welcome.png

string.name: welcome_waypoint_marker_answer
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content answer on waypoint markers.
Screenshot: welcome.png

resources.string: Waypoint markers are used to annotate a location. For example, if you are recording a track and you are close to an interesting place, press Menu -> Markers -> Insert waypoint.

string.name: welcome_waypoint_marker_question
string.translation_description:
In the 'Welcome' page, the help content question on waypoint markers.
Screenshot: welcome.png
